intro: Xantolis, commonly known as the golden lily, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters and emit a subtle fragrance. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged in a spiral pattern along its stem. Xantolis thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires a warm, humid environment to flourish. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for botanical gardens and exotic plant collections.
